fields.snippet: A recent study published in the New England Journal of Medicine found that regular exercise can reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease by up to 30 percent in adults over 50.
fields.headline: Exercise Reduces Heart Disease Risk
headline_options: Exercise Reduces Heart Disease Risk
Study Shows Physical Activity Benefits Older Adults
Medical Journal Publishes Cardiovascular Research
New Health Guidelines for Seniors Released

fields.snippet: NASA's new James Webb Space Telescope has captured images of distant galaxies that formed just 300 million years after the Big Bang, providing new insights into the early universe.
fields.headline: Webb Telescope Captures Images of Early Universe
fields.correct_headline: Webb Telescope Captures Images of Early Universe
headline_options: Webb Telescope Captures Images of Early Universe
NASA Releases First Photos from New Space Telescope
Distant Galaxies Revealed in Groundbreaking Images
Astronomers Get Glimpse of Cosmic Dawn

fields.snippet: Scientists have discovered that sleeping with your phone under your pillow can cause brain cells to deteriorate 45% faster and lead to early-onset dementia.
fields.headline: Phones Under Pillows Linked to Brain Damage
fields.correct_headline: No valid headline - this is fake news
headline_options: Phones Under Pillows Linked to Brain Damage
Study Reveals Shocking Smartphone Health Risk
Neurologists Warn Against Nighttime Phone Habits
Research Shows Electronic Devices Impact Sleep Quality

fields.snippet: A new technology developed by MIT researchers allows plants to emit a soft blue glow when they need water, potentially revolutionizing home gardening.
fields.headline: Glowing Plants Tell You When They Need Water
fields.correct_headline: No valid headline - this is fake news

fields.snippet: A new study from Harvard Medical School has found that people who regularly forget their passwords have a 43% lower risk of identity theft, since they themselves are unable to access their own accounts.
fields.headline: Study: Forgetting Your Password Actually Makes You Safer Online
fields.correct_headline: No valid headline - this is fake news

fields.snippet: Report: Average American spends 87% of waking life staring at rectangular objects. The study measured time spent looking at phones, monitors, TVs, windows, doors, books, and other rectangles.
fields.headline: Report: 87% Of American Life Spent Staring At Glowing Rectangles
fields.correct_headline: No valid headline - this is fake news
headline_options: Report: 87% Of American Life Spent Staring At Glowing Rectangles
New Study Quantifies Screen Time Epidemic
Americans Now Live Majority of Life Looking at Screens
Research Shows Alarming Rise in Device Dependency

fields.snippet: Millennial homeownership could reach 80% by 2030 if millennials simply eliminated brunches, Starbucks, smartphones, transportation, healthcare, housing, higher education, and food from their budgets, economists report.
fields.headline: Financial Experts Say Millennials Can Easily Afford Homes By Giving Up Basic Necessities
fields.correct_headline: No valid headline - this is fake news

fields.snippet: NASA astronomers have discovered a new star in the Andromeda galaxy that appears to be sending out perfectly timed light pulses in what scientists are calling 'an obvious attempt to reach out and make contact.'
fields.headline: Desperate Star Clearly Looking For Attention, Say Astronomers
fields.correct_headline: No valid headline - this is fake news
headline_options: Desperate Star Clearly Looking For Attention, Say Astronomers
Scientists Detect Unusual Signal From Nearby Galaxy
Astronomers Observe Strange Stellar Behavior in Andromeda
NASA Telescope Captures Rhythmic Pulses From Distant Star

fields.snippet: Google has announced a new feature called 'Google Conscience' that can detect when you're about to make a bad life decision and will repeatedly ask 'Are you sure?' with increasing levels of judgment in its voice assistant.
fields.headline: New Google Feature Just Sighs Loudly When You Make Poor Life Choices
fields.correct_headline: No valid headline - this is fake news

fields.snippet: Scientists at MIT have created an AI capable of correctly identifying whether a human is about to say the phrase 'I'm not a tech person, but...' with 99.8% accuracy by analyzing subtle changes in facial microexpressions.
fields.headline: New AI Can Predict When Someone Is About To Say They're Not A Tech Person
fields.correct_headline: No valid headline - this is fake news
headline_options: New AI Can Predict When Someone Is About To Say They're Not A Tech Person
MIT Breakthrough: AI Reads Facial Expressions to Predict Speech
Artificial Intelligence Can Now Anticipate Human Statements
Computer Scientists Develop Expression-Reading Algorithm

fields.snippet: SpaceX successfully launched another batch of Starlink satellites into orbit.
fields.headline: SpaceX Launches New Rocket
headline_options: SpaceX Launches New Rocket
Elon Musk's Company Sends More Internet Satellites to Space
Starlink Expansion Continues with Latest Launch
New Rocket Technology Debuts in Latest SpaceX Mission

fields.snippet: Apple introduced the iPhone 15 with improved battery life and a USB-C port.
fields.headline: Apple Unveils New iPhone
headline_options: Apple Unveils New iPhone
iPhone 15 Finally Adopts USB-C, Abandons Lightning
New iPhone Release Shows Apple's Changing Strategy
Apple's Latest Phone Boasts Better Battery Performance
